front.title: BGP based Multi-homing in Virtual Private LAN Service

abstract.t: Virtual Private LAN Service (VPLS) is a Layer 2 Virtual Private Network (VPN) that gives its customers the appearance that their sites are connected via a Local Area Network (LAN). It is often required for the Service Provider (SP) to give the customer redundant connectivity to some sites, often called "multi-homing". This memo shows how BGP-based multi-homing can be offered in the context of LDP and BGP VPLS solutions. This document updates [RFC4761] by defining new flags in the Control Flags field of the Layer2 Info Extended Community.
